That's what unmanned space probes are for
*If* you've researched them. If you have, then you can start flinging probes at other planets, the way the Soviets used to bomb Venus.

Do suborbitals around Kerban. Launch in different directions so that you land in the ocean, the desert, the plains, on the mountains, at the poles. Do an EVA, collect samples, make observations, and get recovered. Soon, you will have enough science points to unlock parts for multistage rockets and science pods. Then, you can go into orbit, Mun and Minmus flyby, land back on Kerban, and get max science points for those missions. Eventually, you can unlock probes, batteries, and solar panels to start launching deep space missions and land on the other worlds. From there on, it is manned missions and return from those other worlds for even more science points.
I suggest going to Eve or Duna. Unmanned science landers give you a lot of points, and you can then unlock parts for manned missions.
